isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - TROUBLESHOOTING TEST CHARTS

svcprocinfo.para: The troubleshooting charts in this section make reference to connector and circuit numbers for the 2000, 4000, and 8000 model families. For other models, refer to the appropriate circuit diagram book for the corresponding circuit and connector numbers.

svcsubproc.title: ECU and Shift Selector Power and Ground Circuits

table.title: ECU and Shift Selector Power and Ground Circuits

entry.para: Disconnect conn. (632) from WTEC III ECU and measure voltage from pin 1/circuit 136 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 136, conn. (418), circuit 136B or 136 from fuse at (301), then repair.
At disconnected conn. (632), measure voltage from pin 16/circuit 136A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 136, conn. (418), circuit 136B or 136A from fuse at (301), then repair.
At disconnected connector (632), measure resistance from pin 17/circuit 143 to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143, 143E, conn. (418), circuit 193E, conn. (13), circuit A343, conn. (807), circuit A343 or 11-GA, conn. (426), circuit 11-G, conn. (665) or circuit 11-G to negative battery terminal, then repair.
At disconnected conn. (632), measure resistance from pin 32/circuit 143D to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143D, 143E, conn. (418), circuit 193E, conn. (13), circuit A343, conn. (807), circuit A343 or 11-GA, conn. (426), circuit 11-G, conn. (665) or circuit 11-G to negative battery terminal, then repair.
At disconnected conn. (632), measure resistance from pin 25/circuit 144 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 144, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (632) and disconnect shift selector (420). At conn. (420)/pin R/circuit 136C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 136C, connector (418), or circuit 136C, then repair.
At disconnected conn. (420), measure resistance from pin P/circuit 143A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143A, conn. (418), or circuit 143A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (420) and disconnect conn. (634). Move key switch to ignition position and at pin 4/circuit 146A, measure voltage to ground.
Allison ECU and shift selector power and ground circuit test good.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 146, conn. (418), circuit 146 or 146A from key switch and fuse (301), then repair.

Disconnect conn. (634) from the Allison ECU, (379) from the engine ECM, (288) from ABS ECU, and (27) from instrument cluster. At conn. (634) measure resistance from pin 1/circuit 142(+) to pin 17/circuit 151(-).
Locate short on communications link between circuits 142(+) and 151(-) or between circuits 98J(+)/RD and 98H/BL, or between 98A(+) and 98C(-), or 98B(+) and 98D(-), then repair.
With long test leads, or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin 1/circuit 142(+) and conn. (379)/pin 16/circuit 98A(+).
Locate open or poor conn. in circuit 142(+), conn. (418), circuit 142(+), conn. (427), circuit 98A(+), conn. (3) or circuit 98A(+), then repair.
With long test leads, or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin1/circuit 142(+) and conn. (288)/pin G2/RD wire.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 142(+) conn. (418), circuit 142(+), conn. (427), circuit 98J(+), conn. (13), or the RD wire, then repair.
With long test leads, or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin1/circuit 142(+) and conn. (27)/pin 7/circuit 98E(+).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 142(+), conn. (418), circuit 142(+), conn. (427) or circuit 98E(+), then repair.
With long test leads or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin 17/circuit 151(-) and conn. (379)/pin 17/circuit 98C(-).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 151(-), conn. (418), circuit 151(-), conn. (428), circuit 98C(-), conn. (3), or circuit 98C(-), then repair.
With long test leads or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin 17/circuit 151(-) and conn. (288)/pin G3/BL wire.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 151(-), conn. (418), circuit 151(-), conn. (428), circuit 98K(-), conn. (13), or the BL wire, then repair.
With long test leads or by jumping one end to ground, measure resistance between conn. (634)/pin 17/circuit 151(-) and conn. (27)/pin 9/circuit 98F(-).
Communication link cir. test good, reconnect conn.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 151(-), conn. (418), circuit 151(-), conn. (428) or circuit 98F(-), then repair.

Disconnect shift selector conn. (420) and ECU conn. (634). At one conn. or the other, check for shorts between circuits 124, 136C, 143A, 170, 171, 172, 173, 174, 175 and 180. NOTE: Do not measure resistance between pins T and V (connected by splice), or pin U and T or V (energized when panel lights are on.
Locate short between circuits, then repair.
Measure continuity of each individual circuit 124, 136C, 143A, 170, 171, 172, 173, 174, 175 and 180 between connector (420) and (634).
Shift selector harness circuitry tests good.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit, then repair.

Remove neutral start relay (615). Place a test jumper at the relay socket between circuit 97P and 97AU and with parking brake applied, briefly move key switch to start position. Does cranking motor energize?
Remove test jumper. Move key switch to ignition position and at the relay socket measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, conn. (2), cir. 97P, conn. (438)/(721), circuit 97P, conn. (631), or circuit 97P from fuse F17, then repair.
Remove crank inhibit relay (661), move key switch to ignition position, and with park brake applied briefly apply a test jumper between circuit 17 and 17F. Does cranking motor energize?
Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL, Electrical Troubleshooting Manual for further diagnostics of the cranking and charging system.
At neutral relay socket (615), install a test jumper between circuit 97P and 97AU. At crank inhibit relay socket (661), measure voltage from circuit 97L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97AU, conn. (631), circuit 97AU, conn. (720)/(438), circuit 97AU, conn. (2), circuit 97AU, conn. and jumper plug (386) or circuit 97L, then repair.
Disconnect ECM conn. (379) and move key switch to ignition position. With jumper still installed at (615), measure voltage at conn. (379) circuit 97A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97A, conn. (3), or circuit 97A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (379). Move key switch to ignition position. With jumper still in place at relay socket (615), measure voltage between circuits 17 and 97H at relay socket (661).

With an electronic service tool, verify that the output at the Diamond LogicNavpaktrade; ECM (379) pin 46 is low. If not, reprogram and replace ECM. Otherwise locate open or poor connection in circuit 97H, conn. (3), or circuit 97H, then repair.
Bench test relay (661) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to pin 87A.
Bench test relay (661) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86 and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At relay socket (615), measure resistance from circuit 143B to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143B, 143E, conn. (418), circuit 193E, conn. (13), circuit A343, conn. (807), circuit A343, 11-GA, conn. (426), circuit 11-G, conn. (665), or circuit 11-G to battery "-" terminal, then repair.
Place transmission in neutral, move key switch to ignition position and at relay socket (615) measure voltage from circuit 123 to ground.
Neutral start system circuits check good. Re-install all relays and reconnect conn.
Measure resistance of circuit 123 between socket (615) and ECU (632).
Neutral start system circuits check good. Re-install all relays and reconnect conn.
Have Allison dealer troubleshoot neutral switch circuitry, and reprogram/replace ECU that does not switch pin 6 high when transmission is in neutral.
Disconnect Allison ECU connector (634) and use a test jumper to connect pin 31/circuit 115 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, re-connect conn. (634), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove Check Trans warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect conn. (26), and with jumper still attached at conn. (634), measure resistance from conn. (26) circuit 115/pin 2 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92, conn. (377) circuit 115, conn. (418), or circuit 115, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (634), reconnect conn. (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (634).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.

svcsubproc.title: Panel Light Feed and Backlight Circuits

table.title: Panel Light Feed and Backlight Circuits

entry.para: Disconnect shift selector conn. (420) and measure resistance from circuit 186/pin T to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 186, 94-GC, conn. (377), circuit 94-GC, or 11-GL, then repair.
Measure resistance at conn. (420) from circuit 188/pin U to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 188, 94-GC, conn. (377), circuit 94-GC, or 11-GL, then repair.

Place headlight switch (35) in headlight or park light position, dimmer switch (33) in bright position, and at conn. (420) measure voltage from circuit 187/pin U to ground. NOTE: If none of the panel lights illuminate, refer to troubleshooting of panel lights in Electrical Troubleshooting Manual of specific model being repaired.
Panel light feed circuits for shift selector backlighting check good. Reconnect conn. (420) and if backlighting fails to illuminate, repair shift selector.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 62J, 187, conn. (377), or circuit 187J from panel light feed block, then repair.
Remove reverse relay (639), and at the relay socket, connect a test jumper between circuit 71 and 71A. Do the back-up lights illuminate when the key switch is moved to the ignition position?
At relay socket (639), remove jumper and measure voltage from circuit 71 to ground with the key switch in the ignition position.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 13, 71, conn. (2), circuit 71, conn. (304), circuit 71, conn. (631), or circuit 71 from key switch, then repair.
Remove back-up light bulbs and check for open condition.
Re-install jumper, at relay socket (639), between circuits 71 and 71A. Move key switch to ignition position and at left back-up light socket measure voltage from blue wire to ground.
LT back-up light bulb socket, BL wire to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 71A, conn. (631), circuit 71A, conn. (304), circuit 71A, conn. (2), circuit 71B, 71A, conn. (13) or the blue wire, then repair.
At right back-up light socket measure voltage from blue wire to ground.
RT back-up light bulb socket, BL wire to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Power feed to back-up lights check good. Re-install bulbs and if lights fail to illuminate, check and repair ground circuit or replace socket if necessary.
At relay socket (639) remove test jumper and measure voltage from circuit 146C to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 146, conn. (418), circuit 146 or 146C from fuse (301), then repair.
Disconnect ECU conn. (632) and measure resistance of circuit 113.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 113, then repair.
Bench test reverse relay (639) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test reverse relay (639) by applying + 12V to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect ECU connector (632), re-install reverse relay (639), start engine, and place transmission in reverse. Do back-up lights illuminate?
Back-up light relay and circuits check good.
Have Allison dealer troubleshoot reverse switch circuitry and reprogram/ replace ECU that does not switch pin 4 low when transmission is in reverse.

svcsubproc.title: Torque Converter Lock Drop Circuitry for ABS Brake System

table.title: Torque Converter Lock Drop Circuitry for ABS Brake System

entry.para: Disconnect ABS ECU conn. (288), attach a jumper wire from pin K1 to ground, remove TCL drop relay (570) and measure resistance from circuit 94J to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in the yellow wire, connector (13), or circuit 94J, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and measure resistance from circuit 94J to ground at connector (288).
Reconnect conn. Go to next step.
Locate short to ground in circuit 94J or yellow wire, then repair.
Bench test TCL drop relay (570) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to pin 87A.
Bench test TCL drop relay (570) ay applying + 12V to pin 85, ground to 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At relay socket (570) measure resistance from circuit 87 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161A, conn. (418), circuit 161A or 161, then repair.
Move key switch to ignition position and at relay socket (570) measure voltage to ground at circuit 94F.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13K, 13L, or 94F from fuse (301), then repair.
Disconnect connector (632) and measure resistance from circuit 154A to relay socket (570) circuit 154E.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 154A, conn. (418), or circuit 154E, then repair.
At socket (570) measure resistance from circuit 154E to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 154E or 154A, then repair.

Torque converter lock-up circuits from ABS ECU to WTEC III ECU check good. If torque converter fails to lock-up, use an electronic service tool to monitor WTEC III and ABS ECU inputs and output state.
Is two-speed axle stuck in high speed?
Even though axle is stuck in high speed, does speedometer change scales when two-speed switch is moved between high and low? [Can be observed or measure at pin 28 of ECM (379)].
Disconnect ECU connector (632), and with two speed switch set to low, measure resistance from pin 31/circuit 161 to pin 12/circuit 153.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161, 161C, conn. (466), circuit 93, conn. (495), circuit 93, switch and conn. (75), circuit 93F, conn. (495), circuit 93F, conn. (466), circuit 153, or conn. (632), then repair.
At (632), with two-speed switch set to high speed, measure resistance from pin 31/circuit 161 to pin 12/circuit 153.
Replace defective two speed switch (75), or short between circuits, then repair.
Remove two-speed relay (488), reconnect conn. (632), and move key switch to ignition position. At socket (488) measure voltage from circuit 93E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 93, conn. (14), circuit 93, conn. (495) or circuit 93E from fuse F14, then repair.
With two-speed switch in low speed position, measure voltage at socket (488) from circuit 93E to 93D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 93D, conn. (466), or circuit 114, or problem with ECU programming that will not allow pin 2 of the ECU (632) to switch low.
Bench test two-speed relay (488) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test two-speed relay (488) by applying +12 volts to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (488), disconnect conn. (379), move key switch to ignition position and two-speed switch to low position. At (379) pin 28/circuit 93A measure voltage to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 93B, conn. (495), circuit 93B, conn. (14), circuit 93A, conn. (2), or circuit 93A, then repair.

With key off, reconnect conn. (379) and disconnect axle solenoid. Move key switch to ignition position, leave two-speed switch in low, and at brown wire that feeds the solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Locate short to voltage source, then repair.
With key still on, move two-speed switch to high speed position, and at brown wire that feeds the solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Two-speed axle circuits check good. Turn key off and reconnect BN wire. If shift solenoid fails to function, replace it.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 93C, conn. (495), circuit 93C, conn. (14), circuit 93C, conn. (13), the RD wire, conn. (N/L), or a brown wire, then repair.
Disconnect ECU conn. (632), and with two-speed switch set to low, measure resistance from pin 31/circuit 161 to pin 12/circuit 153.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161, 161C, conn. (466), circuit 93, conn. (495), circuit 93, switch and conn. (75), circuit 93F, conn. (495) circuit 93F, conn. (466), circuit 153 or conn. (63), then repair.
At (632), with two-speed switch set to high speed, measure resistance from pin 31/circuit 161 to pin 12/circuit 153.
Replace defective two-speed switch (75), or short between circuits, then repair.
Remove two-speed relay (488), reconnect conn. (632), and move key switch to ignition position. At socket (488) measure voltage from circuit 93E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 93, conn. (14), circuit 93, conn. (495) or circuit 93E from fuse F14, then repair.
With two-speed switch in low speed position, measure voltage at socket (488) from circuit 93E to 93D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 93D, conn. (466), or circuit 114, or problem with ECU programming that will not allow pin 2 of the ECU (632) to switch low, then repair.
Bench test two-speed relay (488) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test two-speed relay (488) by applying +12 volts to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (488), disconnect conn. (379), move key switch to ignition position and two-speed switch to low position. At (379) pin 28/circuit 93A measure voltage to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 93B, conn. (495), circuit 93B, conn. (14), circuit 93A, conn. (2), or circuit 93A, then repair.
With key off, reconnect conn. (379), and disconnect conn. (703). Move key switch to ignition position, leave two-speed switch in low, and at brown wire that feeds (703), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 93B, conn. (495), circuit 93B, conn. (14), circuit 93B, conn. (13), or the brown wire, then repair.
With switches still set, as in previous step, at red wire that feeds (703), measure voltage to ground.
Locate short to voltage source, then repair.
With key still on, move two-speed switch to high speed position, and at red wire that feeds connector (703), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 93C, conn. (495), circuit 93C, conn. (14), circuit 93C, conn. (13) or the RD wire, then repair.
With switches still set as in previous step, at brown wire that feeds (703), measure voltage to ground.
Two-speed axle circuits check good. Turn key off and reconnect (703). If two- speed motor fails to function, replace it.
Locate short to voltage source, then repair.
Disconnect ECM connector (379), and move key switch to ignition position. Does exhaust brake solenoid energize?
At conn. (379) connect a jumper wire between pin 47 and ground. Does exhaust brake solenoid de-energize?
With conn. (379) still disconnected and key switch still on, disconnect exhaust brake solenoid connector (N/L) and measure voltage from circuit 24E to ground.
Bench test relay (449) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (449) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Move key switch to ignition position and at relay socket (449) and circuit 24D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 97K, conn. (3), circuit 24B, conn. (372), circuit 24B or 24A from fuse F4A, then repair.
At relay socket (449) and circuit 24C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 24C, then repair.
With (379) still disconnect, re-stall relay (449) and disconnect exhaust brake solenoid conn. (N/L). At (N/L) circuit 24E measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 24E, then repair.
Reconnect exhaust brake solenoid. Does solenoid energize?
Disconnect Allison ECU conn. (634), move key switch to ignition position and engine brake on/off switch to on position, and at circuit 119 measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 146A, switch (447), circuit 119, conn. (418), or circuit 119 from fuse (301), then repair.
Bench test engine brake relay (667) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test engine brake relay (667) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At relay socket (667) measure resistance from circuit 94-GE to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94-GE, conn. (418), circuit 94-GE, 94-GC or 11-G, then repair.
With ECM conn. (379) still disconnected, install a jumper at relay socket (667) from circuit 94-GE to 24, and at conn. (379) measure resistance from circuit 24 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 24, conn. (418), circuit 24, conn. (377), circuit 24, conn. (3) or circuit 24, then repair.

Re-install relay (667), reconnect connector (634), and reconnect connector (379). Exhaust brake system circuits check good. If system fails to function properly use an electronic service tool to troubleshoot ECM and ECU operation.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Retarder
svcsubproc.para: Before beginning test of hydraulic retarder circuits, using an electronic tool where necessary, verify that the following conditions for operation are met:

item.para: Retarder enable switch (917) is in the on position.
No active Allison transmission error codes are present.
Transmission is in a forward gear.
Throttle commanded is less than 9.8% (or with throttle failure, the service brakes are applied).
The transmission output speed is less than 350 rpm.
The output from retarder control interface module (922A) must be greater than or equal to 15 counts.

entry.para: Disconnect ECM conn. (379), move retarder on/off switch to on position, and at circuit 24/pin 15 measure resistance to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 24, conn. (3), circuit 24, conn. (377-A), circuit 24, circuit 24V, switch and conn. (917), circuit 92-G, 92-GY, 94-GC, conn. (377-A), circuit 94-GC or 11-G to cab ground, then repair.
Remove retarder enable relay (790), install a jumper between circuit 24A and ground, and at ECM conn. (379) measure resistance from circuit 24A/pin 47 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 24A, conn. (372), circuit 24A, conn. (789), or circuit 24A, then repair.
Reconnect connector (379), move key switch to ignition position, and at relay socket (790) measure voltage from circuit 24B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 13A, fuse F4, circuit 97K, conn. (3), circuit 97K, conn. (372), circuit 24B, conn. (789), or circuit 24B, then repair.
At relay socket (790), measure resistance from circuit 161D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161D or 161 to ECU signal ground, then repair.
Bench test retarder enable relay (790) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test retarder enable relay (790) by applying +12V to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Disconnect Allison ECU conn. (634) and measure resistance of circuit 163 between conn. (634)/pin 27 and (790) cavity 1.
Re-install retarder enable relay (790). Go to next step.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 163, then repair.
Remove brake status relay (923) and measure resistance from circuit 161E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161E, then repair.
Reconnect Allison ECU conn. (634) and disconnect conn. (632). Measure resistance of circuit 137 between conn. (632) and (923).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 137, then repair.
At relay socket (923), measure resistance from circuit 161E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 161E, then repair.
While an assistant applies the service brakes, at relay socket (923), circuit 70Y, measure voltage to ground.

Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 70Y, 70N, conn. (499), circuit 70N, 70A, switch and conn. (70), circuit 70R, 70, conn. (46), or circuit 70 from fuse F9, [also circuit 70N, 70W, switch and conn. (71), circuit 70Z from circuit 70], then repair.
At relay socket (923), measure resistance from circuit 70-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G or 70-GA to ECU ground, then repair.
Bench test service brake status relay (923) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (923) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (923). Go to next step.

Input circuits for retarder check good. If conditions listed at beginning of this test are met, the retarder should function. Short circuits or opens in output circuits to accumulator solenoid (647) and H solenoid (648) should set a fault code. In the rare event of a high resistance short to ground, a fault would not be detected, and an error code would not be set by the ECU. Do you want to test output harness to retarder?
Disconnect ECU conn. (633), accumulator conn. (647), and retarder conn. (648). At conn. (633) measure resistance between circuits 101, 127, 116, and all other circuits in connector.
Locate short between circuits, then repair.
At conn. (647) install a jumper wire between circuits 101 and 116. At conn. (633) measure resistance from circuit 101 to 116.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 101, conn. (631), circuits 101, 116A, 116, conn. (631), or circuit 116, then repair.
Move jumper wire to conn. (648) between circuits 127 and 116B. At conn. (633) measure resistance from circuit 127 to 116.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 127, conn. (631), circuits 127, 116B, 116, conn. (631), or circuit 116, then repair.
Disconnect auto neutral on/off switch (958), move to on position, and measure resistance from pin 5 to 6.
At connector (958) measure resistance from circuit 143B to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143B, or 143A to dash panel cab ground (2G), then repair.
Reconnect conn. (958) and make sure switch is in the on position. With parking brakes applied, disconnect ECU conn. (632), and measure resistance from circuit 153/pin 12 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 153A, park brake switch (3010), circuit 153, conn. (466), or circuit 153, then repair.
At connector (632) measure resistance from circuit 117/pin 30 to circuit 161/pin 31.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 117, conn. (466), circuit 117, switch (1001), circuit 161C, conn. (466), or circuit 161C, then repair.
Remove relay (962). At ECU connector (632) install a test jumper between circuit 114/pin 2 and ground. At relay socket (962) measure resistance from circuit 114 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 114, conn. (466), or circuit 114, then repair.
Move key switch to ignition position, and at relay socket (962) measure voltage from circuit 146E to 114.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13J, conn. (377), circuit 13M, fuse 301, circuit 146, 146E, conn. (1), or circuit 146E, then repair.
Bench test neutral indicator relay (962) by measuring resistance from 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (962) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, gnd. to pin 86, and measuring resistance from 30 to 87.
At relay socket (962) measure resistance of circuit 146F between socket pins 1 and 5.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 146F, then repair.
Disconnect neutral indicator conn. (961), re-install relay (962), and move key switch to ignition position. At conn. (961) and circuit 114NO, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 114NO, then repair.
At connector (961) measure voltage from circuit 114NO to 143D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 143D, switch (960-A), or circuit 143C, then repair.
Reconnect connector (961). Does neutral indicator light illuminate?
Auto neutral circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (632). If problems persist, use an electronic service tool to monitor ECU inputs and outputs.
